ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I gained valuable skills for learning Spanish and how to approach the process. My knowledge of the language and culture was greatly improved.
I learned the basics of speaking spanish and how to learn vocabulary for speaking purposes.
I became much better at speaking spanish and i learned a lot about the cultures of spanish speaking countries.
I deepened my understanding of the Spanish Language

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: I thought it was pretty well structured, but would have been better if we did more practice and covered more test material during class time.
This course was strongly organized, had effective instructor-student communication, and was very engaging. The only weakness of the course was that it was fast-paced.

It's a lot of busy work. And honestly I think it may be too much material for one semester. Also all of the students except for about two, myself included, had taken Spanish before which was rather unfair.
my professor was a definite strength of the course.
I love the teaching style of the course. The professor made sure everyone spoken everyday which helped with engagement and retention.

The strength is that youre given so much Spanish material to do that you cant help but develop an understanding of the language. The weakness is that some of these tasks and assignments may be beneficial for some while tedious for others

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes. If looking to take another language starting from square one.

I would certainly recommend this course to another student. This course provided me with an excellent foundation for learning the language, and I can't wait to continue in L2. I also enjoyed how the course put an emphasis on learning Spanish culture as well; I found those lessons to be especially interesting.
Yes, but only students who had taken Spanish before. Otherwise I would say to take a different new language.
